basic_info.description: Hello, my name is Kai-Jen and I am a master student at the University of Washington studying Electrical Engineering. I am a skilled software developer with experience in C++, Python, Rust, Java, and Javascript. I am currently taking courses in computer networks and distributed systems, and have begun a project on cybersecurity sandboxing. As a student and a developer, I am passionate about technology and its potential to change the world. I am eager to apply my skills and knowledge in a software engineering internship for the summer of 2023. Thank you for visiting my profile.

projects.title: HTTP Server
projects.description: A high-performance HTTP server capable of concurrently handling multiple client requests

projects.title: VGG Classification for MNIST fashion dataset
projects.description: During the AI for Engineer course, I worked on a project to develop and train a VGG neural network to classify the MNIST Fashion dataset with high accuracy rates. This project demonstrated my proficiency in deep learning and computer vision techniques. To optimize the performance of the VGG model, I designed and executed experiments that compared different model architectures and hyperparameters on the MNIST Fashion dataset. Through this experimentation, I showcased my advanced skills in machine learning optimization and experimentation

projects.title: RFID MMAP protocol and attack
projects.description: During my Cryptography and Network Security course, I worked on a project to develop and implement an RFID MMAP Oracle system. As part of the project, I also designed and executed a series of attacks to identify potential security vulnerabilities in the system.

projects.title: A* Algorithm
projects.description: A simple A-star algorithm can be used to find the shortest path to the goal when there are rectangular obstacles present.

projects.title: Worldquant International Quant Championship
projects.description: As a participant in the WorldQuant Trading Algorithm Competition, I was part of a team that achieved impressive results, ranking among the Top 5 in the WorldQuant International Quant Championship and becoming a finalist in the Stage 2 National Round. In this highly competitive arena, we developed and implemented innovative trading strategies designed to maximize profits while minimizing risks. We presented our ideas on the national stage and engaged in extensive research, reading and analyzing a variety of quantitative finance journals. Through this experience, I honed my skills in quantitative analysis, financial modeling, and teamwork, and gained valuable insights into the fast-paced and dynamic world of trading algorithms.

projects.title: CO2 Reduction Research Article, JACS
projects.description: Dynamic Reoxidation/Reduction-Driven Atomic Interdiffusion for Highly Selective CO2 Reduction toward Methane, Journal of the American Chemical Society

education.coursework: Coursework: Calculus, Linear Algebra, Discrete Mathematics, Ordinary Differential Equations, Quantum Chemistry, Electricity and Magnetism, Advanced Analytical Chemistry
Coursework: Financial Engineering and Computation, Quantitative Methods in Finance, Principles of Financial Computing, Modern Investment Management, Special Topics on Financial Engineering

education.degree: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering
education.coursework: Coursework: Network Security & Cryptography, Probability & Stochastic Process, AI for Engineers, Computer-Communication Network, Distributed System

experience.title: Data Engineer
description: Collaborated with cross-functional teams to revamp the internal website, enabling efficient monitoring of pipeline jobs using Python, Flask, HTML, and CSS
Successfully resolved complex technical issues to unblock production deployment

Built an internal website using JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Node.js, and Kubernetes to monitor the health status of Hadoop cluster machines and manage nodes, contributing to streamlined data processing workflows
Effectively communicated with data scientists to identify and resolve ad hoc data pipeline issues, promoting efficient and accurate data analysis
Developed new tools using Python to facilitate the work of data scientists and product teams, resulting in increased operational efficiency and reduced data processing time
Implemented an Airflow alert system using Python to monitor data quality and detect failures, simplifying the debugging process and ensuring high data accuracy standards

experience.title: Backend Engineer
description: Designed and implemented an efficient and extendable data processing pipeline for a machine learning model using Rustâ€™s multi-threading capabilities, allowing simultaneous processing of tens of millions of data points

Collaborated closely with traders to develop tools and strategies for quickly processing and analyzing large amounts of data, supporting efficient and effective decision-making in the highly competitive crypto trading market

experience.title: Quantitative Analyst
description: Designed and developed an automated tool using Python to analyze tens of thousands of trading data, enabling rapid identification of trading opportunities and optimization of trading strategies
Leveraged statistical and machine learning models, including Scikit-learn, to develop and refine trading methods, resulting in improved profitability and risk management for the trading firm
Collected and transformed market data using Python to support discretionary trading, providing valuable insights and enhancing the accuracy of trading decisions

experience.company: Department of Chemistry, National Taiwan University
experience.title: Undergraduate student researcher
description: Investigated the Photoelectrochemical CO2 Reduction by synthesizing Cu-based catalysts and utilizing TEM and SEM to investigate their surface properties
Conducted experiments using Cyclic Voltametry and GC/MS to test the properties of the catalysts and evaluated their efficiency in CO2 reduction
Developed a program using Python to automate the transformation of experiment raw data into human-readable plots, improving the efficiency and accuracy of data analysis
Collaborated with other researchers to analyze and interpret experimental results and contributed to the publication of research findings in peer-reviewed journals

experience.company: Academia Sinica Institute of Atomic and Molecular Sciences
experience.title: Research Intern
description: Conducted research on the Criegee Intermediate in the Atmosphere, collecting UV absorbance spectrum data to analyze the reaction rate with H2S
Assisted with the setup of the optical table for the experiment, ensuring proper calibration and accurate measurements
Utilized Matlab to analyze and interpret collected data, determining the reaction rate of the Criegee intermediate with H2S
